Posts.Content: I just wanted to know if anyone can give me any decent advice about the cystoscopy procedure. My vital stats are in this post: http://www.cancerforums.net/threads/...-Some-concerns I have known my Urologist for 15 years and he only tells you the good stuff. Heres my guess The procedure itself will not be too bad since I will either be put out or numbed. Post procedure it will probably hurt like a sonovabitch when I go to the bathroom for a few days to a week. How did I do? Anything else I should be aware of? What are the chances that it will finally resolve my discomfort issues?
Posts.Title: Cystoscopy with a possible dilation???

Posts.Content: I just wanted to know if anyone can give me any decent advice about the cystoscopy procedure. My vital stats are in this post: http://www.cancerforums.net/threads/...-Some-concerns I have known my Urologist for 15 years and he only tells you the good stuff. Posts.Title: Cystoscopy with a possible dilation???

Posts.Content: I wanted some second and third opinions. Thanks in advance. I had just about the lowest form of prostate cancer that anyone would even do anything about. I opted for LDR/HDR which ended in May 2015. The treatments went well with some negative affects from the radiation, but not nearly as bad as my imagination thought it could be. But since then there hasnt been one day where I did not have a burning sensation when I pee. I have been on Tamsulosin since the treatments began. I tried to stop taking them for a few days and my stream went from medium to weakso Im back. I tried UTA and except for the pretty color, they did not have much effect. After a 4 month fight with my insurance company, I was actually able to get a daily 5mg does of Cialis. That helped some, but not completely. Helped a little in the bedroom as well, but far from completely. Ive been on Cialis for 6 months. My radiologist has put me on a 3 month regiment of Pentoxifylline, Indomethacin, and vitamin E. Im about half way through and it has helped, but again, not all the way. As expected, the initial PSA results dropped tremendously, to the 1.2 area. It went down to 1.08 but my last one had a slight uptickwhich my urologist says is not unexpected. I am currently waiting on the latest results. Neither my Urologist or Radiologist are too concerned with my current condition, but I am. My Urologist is suggesting that if the drugs do not help, he can perform a Cystoscopy with a possible dilation. Am I ever going to urinate normally? Will my sex life (currently rated in the 1-2 out of 10 range) get better? I also have an odd sensation in my groin. To be tacky, it is best described as blue balls. Ejaculation does not help. This started about 3 weeks ago. Any help would be appreciated. FX
Posts.Title: 16 months out of LDR/HDR  Some concerns

Posts.Content: PSA was as high as 6 but was around 4.0 when I started treatment. Gleason 6, 9 out of 12. I had the biopsies because my Dad had prostate cancer, and my brother has Gleason 6, 3 of 12 (they're just watching him). BTW, since I posted I received my latest PSA. Below 1.0 for the first time. I know that I should be happy, but 16+ months of this has got me a little down. Not an uncommon reaction I'm sure. I do have a theory...let me know what think. I believe that my prostate is finally dying and that's why I have discomfort down there. All my doctors have mentioned numerous times that just because the pain and discomfort is felt in one area, does not mean that is where the issue is...because of all the nerves that are down there.
Posts.Title: 16 months out of LDR/HDR  Some concerns

Posts.Content: Hi Folks, About 12 years ago, I was diagnosed with a rare genetic heart condition. I found a forum on the web, and I credit that organization with saving my life. So Im very pro medical forums. So lets get the numbers out of the way; Gleason score of 6 PSA-4.0 Cancer found in 9 of 12 places with the biopsy. My wife and I have been around the web a few laps in researching my treatment options. What I wanted to know is if there is a website or document that lists all the treatment options, their survival rates, and the percentages of side effects (ED, Incontinence, pain, etc)? I would also like to know if the following is a fair statement: Most people opt for surgery (Prostatectomy) because either they have an advanced form of cancer or they want the quickest understanding that their cancer is gone. Appreciate your replies in advance. Felix
Posts.Title: Treatment decision week- couple of questions

Posts.Content: Im afraid I dont post too much. I am 3.5 years out from LDR/HDR radiation treatment. My PSA is down around .3. Look at some of my former posts if you want my stats. Overall, Im in decent shape (just turned 60). I require 20mg of Cialis when I want to  you know with the bride. I do not anticipate ever getting off Flomax. After two cystoscopies, things were better but over time, urinating was getting more difficult, although not painful. Doubling the Flomax dose was not an option as it lowered my blood pressure enough to not feel good at all. I was thinking of maybe taking one Flomax in the morning and one at night when my urologist said I should try Rapaflo. I started taking it every night and it almost immediately helped. However, two weeks in (the day after Thanksgiving) I found myself having intense anxiety. Although I have other life problems over the last 6 months, I did not believe that any of them could cause the level of anxiety that I was feeling. I looked up on line and found that although it isnt common, Rapaflo can caused anxiety. I immediately stopped taking it. I felt somewhat better each day, but I did get some Buspirone this past Tuesday to help. Another symptom that I had, which can be caused by Rapaflo is Tinnitis. That too is getting better although not as much as the anxiety. Having both anxiety and tinnitus makes me believe this incident is surely chemically induced rather than anything psychological. Just wanted to let my fellow survivors know about Rapaflo. FX
Posts.Title: My Experience with Rapaflo...Anxiety

Posts.Content: My reaction to Rapaflo is still pretty rare. It did relieve my urination issues. I would just advise to be careful. FX
Posts.Title: My Experience with Rapaflo...Anxiety

Posts.Content: My reaction to Rapaflo is still pretty rare. It did relieve my urination issues. I would just advise to be careful. FX

Posts.Content: Update: Yesterday, I stopped taking the Buspirone. Then anxiety is mostly gone. The tinnitis is greatly reduced.
